Lack of research: The writer may not have enough information or resources to support their ideas or arguments, which can make the article less compelling or persuasive.
Poor writing skills: The writer may struggle with grammar, spelling, or sentence structure, which can make the article difficult to read and understand.
Limited knowledge of the topic: The writer may not have a deep understanding of the subject matter, which can make the article less engaging and informative.
Lack of focus: The writer may struggle to stay on track and maintain a clear thesis or argument throughout the article, leading to a disorganized or confusing piece.
Limited space: The writer may have been given a limited number of words or pages to work with, which can make it difficult to fully develop their ideas or tell a complete story.
